title: Marcus Rashford: Food voucher U-turn after footballer's campaign
description: The Manchester United star praises the government for agreeing to fund free school meals in England this summer.

title: Coronavirus: What's happening to free school meals this summer?
description: The government in England will now provide free school meals vouchers over the summer holidays.

title: SCOTUS made a monumental ruling
description: Monday's Supreme Court ruling that federal law prohibits discrimination against gay and transgender people in the workplace is a monumental step forward toward justice and equality -- and is potentially a watershed moment for the court itself.

title: She wrote a fantasy novel about a dystopian New York City. Then it came true
description: Sometimes, books come at exactly the right time, and that is certainly the case with "The City We Became," the first book in N.K. Jemisin's "Great Cities" trilogy. The fantasy novel is based on the idea that the essence of New York City is transferred to six humans -- each an avatar for the five boroughs and one for the city as a whole -- who must protect the city, and its people, from an intergalactic multi-dimensional threat that manifests as a gentrifying Woman in White. No one knows how the pandemic-battered New York will fare in the coming months or years, but Jemisin points to the solidarity and resiliency of the city.

title: University of California votes to restore affirmative action nearly 24 years after it was outlawed
description: The University of California has voted to restore affirmative action in hopes of diversifying its student body.

title: There could be 36 communicating intelligent civilizations in our galaxy, study says
description: Earth has proven unique in its ability to host life in the universe so far, leading us to question if we're truly alone.

title: Social distancing: A practical guide to how to socialise now
description: Meeting friends? Here's how to handle the awkward new rules - from sharing food to avoiding hugs.

title: How lavender became a symbol of LGBTQ resistance
description: Every year, as summer beckons, Pride month arrives in a burst of color. Around the world, rainbow flags fly high and revelers turn their faces proudly towards the sky.

title: Boston Dynamics' robot dog is now on sale for $74,500
description: Want a dog without the pain of house training it? Or feeding or walking it? Well, you still can't have one, but Boston Dynamics has begun selling Spot, its robotic dog, to businesses. Spot is up for any task without the need for treats.

title: The Gatlinburg SkyBridge was shut down after a tourist cracked the glass doing a baseball slide
description: A tourist managed to crack the clear glass floor of the largest pedestrian suspension bridge in the United States, forcing the Gatlinburg, Tennessee, landmark to close Monday night for repairs.

title: Royal Ascot: Day one's virtual racegoers
description: Fans of horse racing are being encouraged to dress up at home for front-line charities.

title: Coronavirus: When will pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants reopen?
description: Pubs and restaurants in England are expected to reopen in July, but can I meet a friend for a meal?

title: Coronavirus: Could social distancing of less than two metres work?
description: The government is under pressure to relax the 2m social distancing rule - but is it safe to do so?

title: Turns out your favorite movie is racist. What now?
description: Last week, novelist, director and television writer John Ridley -- an Academy Award winner for his screenplay for the movie "12 Years a Slave" --  wrote a brief but compelling op-ed in the Los Angeles Times, asking HBO (a sister company of CNN under the ownership of WarnerMedia) to take the movie "Gone With the Wind" off of its much-hyped new streaming platform HBO Max.

title: Coronavirus: Five ways shopping will be different from now on
description: Shops in England are preparing to welcome customers back but what will the "new normal" look like?

title: Coronavirus: What's the chance of going on holiday?
description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

title: CDC report offers detailed demographic breakdown of who is getting coronavirus
description: New numbers released by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention offer a comprehensive picture of who in the United States has been diagnosed with Covid-19 and how they fared.

title: Marcus Rashford: Man Utd star a 'hero' in Wythenshawe
description: People in Wythenshawe praise Marcus Rashford for forcing a government U-turn on school meal vouchers.

title: How the rise of supermarkets left out black America
description: If you're like most Americans, you probably think of going to the supermarket and stocking up on groceries as a normal thing, and you take it for granted.

title: Coronavirus: NHS staff need tests 'twice a week'
description: Two leading doctors said regular testing is needed to give patients confidence as the NHS reopens.

title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
description: Lockdown rules are changing in England aimed at helping single people cut off from family and friends.

title: The lengths countries go to for a seat at UN top table
description: Canada, Norway and Ireland are in a tight race for two non-permanent seats on the security council.

title: Some think looser restrictions could make second wave worse
description: The United States could see more than 200,000 deaths from Covid-19 by October 1, a closely watched model predicted Monday as states continue to reopen.

title: Vintage photos show British vacationers gone wild
description: Butlin's vacation resorts were an institution in post-war Britain. The self-contained camps -- where guests were housed in wooden chalets, fed and entertained on-site -- provided a new kind of inexpensive luxury for working families.

title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
description: The first "support bubbles" of people who can meet indoors has been announced in England and Northern Ireland.

title: Can I stay with my boyfriend now? And other questions
description: Questions about support bubbles, and other coronavirus topics

title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
description: Loss of taste and smell have been added to the UK's list of coronavirus symptoms.

title: 'People queued for an hour to enter' the shop
description: As the High Street opens for business, workers tell the BBC what it was like after weeks of lockdown.

title: Can thermal cameras help spot coronavirus?
description: The devices allow a person's temperature to be checked from a distance, but are not always reliable.

title: A Street Cat Named Bob: Stray who inspired series of books dies
description: James Bowen wrote six books about his pet Bob who he chanced upon while battling drug addiction.

title: Flushing 'can propel viral infection 3ft into air'
description: Flushing the toilet with the lid up creates a cloud of spray that may spread infection, study finds.

title: All you need to know about new measures
description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions around the UK?

title: Coronavirus: Dexamethasone proves first life-saving drug
description: Patients should be given the cheap drug without delay, after "fantastic" trial results, experts say.

title: Rents are dropping across the US
description: At the end of May, Ilana Freund landed a deal on an apartment in New York City where she will be attending graduate school. She and her roommate signed a lease on a two-bedroom apartment in the West Village for $4,995 a month. It was a significant discount: Similar apartments in the building were going for around $5,300 before the pandemic took hold, according to the listing agent.

title: Trump administration sues Bolton over book dispute
description:
• Read: Trump administration's lawsuit against Bolton over book
• Stelter explains why Trump and White House are 'clearly rattled' by Bolton's new book

title: Reni Eddo-Lodge: Author makes book chart history
description: The author becomes the first black British writer to top the overall UK book chart.

title: When can I ride an e-scooter legally?
description: With people told to avoid public transport, the government's hoping to trial e-scooter rental schemes.

title: Coronavirus: Prince Charles's sense of smell and taste still not back
description: The prince discusses his experience with Covid-19 as the royals return to public engagements.

title: Black Lives Matter: Have racial inequality reviews led to action?
description: A number of reviews have looked at race and equality over the years, but has the government taken action?

title: Mexico temporarily forbids workers from going to Canada due to coronavirus
description: Mexico will conduct a safety review of Canadian health policies and procedures before allowing any more temporary workers to travel to Canada to work in the agricultural sector.

title: Remarkable idiocy of Trump rally in Tulsa
description: Like many others, I was startled to learn that President Donald Trump was resuming his campaign barnstorming in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Startled that he was hitting the road again in the middle of a pandemic, startled that he had picked the place where a massacre of African Americans occurred (and was covered up) 99 years ago, startled that he initially decided to do this on Juneteenth -- June 19, the holiday celebrating the end of slavery.

title: The first photos of Tom Brady in his Buccaneers uniform are here
description: Patriot fans, you may want to look away.

title: Pence falsely claims Covid-19 cases in Oklahoma are falling
description: During a White House roundtable Monday, Vice President Mike Pence claimed that Oklahoma - where President Donald Trump is scheduled to hold a campaign rally Saturday -  has seen a decline in the number of coronavirus cases.

title: Brazil swipes at FDA, pushes hydroxychloroquine for pregnant women and children
description: Brazilian health authorities said on Monday they will now recommend hydroxychloroquine  to treat children and pregnant women for early treatment of Covid-19, and criticized the US Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) recent decision to revoke the emergency use of the drug.

title: GOP senator: Proposal to remove Confederate names picks on the South
description: A Senate amendment to remove the names of Confederate leaders on military property "picks on the South unfairly," a GOP senator said Tuesday, the latest sign that President Donald Trump's opposition to the plan has opened up an uncomfortable election-year debate within the party.

title: How laundry is spilling plastics into the ocean
description: Off the coast of Cullercoats, in northeast England, researchers Max Kelly and Priscilla Carrillo-Barragan send a long tubular net into the depths of the North Sea.

title: 75-year-old Buffalo protester has a fractured skull and cannot walk
description: Martin Gugino, the 75-year-old protester who was pushed by two Buffalo, New York, police officers earlier this month, has a fractured skull and is not able to walk, his lawyer said in a statement provided to CNN on Monday.

title: A key model used by the White House is now projecting more than 200,000 deaths by October as 18 states show a spike in coronavirus cases
description: Vice President Mike Pence, the leader of the administration's coronavirus task force, is publicly painting a rosy picture of the pandemic through his words and actions amid President Donald Trump's push to reopen the country and resume campaigning.

description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

title: Instagram 'will overtake Twitter as a news source'
description: A report finds Instagram doubled its news audience last year - and could overtake Twitter by 2021.

title: Diego, the Galápagos tortoise with a species-saving sex drive, retires
description: Diego, aged 100, returns to his native Galápagos island after decades of breeding in captivity.

description: Greggs edges towards full reopening while Cineworld cinemas plan to restart screenings in July.

title: Coronavirus: Twelve weeks on I can't kick Covid exhaustion
description: More and more survivors of coronavirus are discovering its impact on their health is long-term.

title: Swindon shooting: Man shot in leg by police after lorry stolen
description: Officers followed the vehicle through Swindon and the man was shot as they intercepted it.

title: Tornadoes caught on camera across two counties in Wales
description: Eyewitnesses filmed a twister near Brecon and then another 40 miles away in Ceredigion.

title: Defense secretary says official who questioned the legality of withholding Ukraine aid to resign
description: The Pentagon official who raised concerns about the Ukraine aid being held in 2019 has submitted her resignation to Secretary of Defense Mark Esper, the Pentagon announced Tuesday.

title: Analysis: Something shocking happened to Republicans in West Virginia last week
description: Last Tuesday in West Virginia, something remarkable happened: 10(!) sitting Republican state legislators -- including the state Senate president and a former House majority leader -- lost in primaries.

title: Trump isn't aging well
description: Donald Trump is not coping well.

title: Coronavirus: Job cuts warning as 600,000 roles go in lockdown
description: Economists say the full impact on employment will not be felt until wage support schemes end in October.

title: An entire high school baseball team knelt during the National Anthem to protest police brutality
description: As Iowa became the first state to resume high school sports this week, one baseball team took a stand by kneeling.

title: Inside 'American Horror Story' creator's LA and NYC homes
description: Writer and director Ryan Murphy was 8 years old when his parents first let him decorate his room. "I decided to buck the bland and go bold: olive-green walls, chocolate-brown shag carpeting -- and a gold disco ball," he recalled in the latest issue of Architectural Digest, as he opened the doors to his quietly luxurious LA and New York homes.

title: Brett Favre is charging $5,000 for a 10-minute Zoom call
description: Some bored and cooped-up celebrities (we're using that term lightly) have apparently hit "Peak Quarantine" are now offering Zoom calls with fans for hundreds -- and even thousands -- of dollars.

title: What's behind the PM's aid department decision?
description: There is a tension at the heart of the plan to merge the Foreign Office and the department handling overseas aid.

title: Coronavirus: Why we don't know how many are being tested
description: The UK Statistics Authority has criticised the government's handling of Covid-19 testing data.

title: Can superspreading be stopped?
description: Identifying superspreading events could be crucial in the fight against the virus, scientists say.

title: Beijing extends residential lockdowns as coronavirus infections spread
description: Authorities in Beijing locked down more residential compounds, had more than 30,000 restaurants disinfected and tightened outbound travel as the Chinese capital's latest coronavirus outbreak continued to spread Tuesday, with more than 100 people now infected.

title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
description: There is a lot of uncertainty around when and how weddings are allowed to take place. What are your rights?

title: Lawyers sue to stop Trump's Tulsa campaign rally over virus fears
description: A group of Tulsa lawyers have filed a lawsuit to stop President Donald Trump from hosting a campaign rally in the Oklahoma city on Saturday unless the organizers agree to take steps to adhere to his administration's own social distancing recommendations to limit the spread of coronavirus.

title: What the pandemic means for our summers
description: Every day we are bombarded with new numbers -- 20,000 new infections and 800-1,000 new deaths every day; projections such as the total US death toll reaching 130,000 by July 4.

title: Analysis: Why will no one in the White House wear a mask?
description: In the Rose Garden on Tuesday afternoon, President Donald Trump announced an executive order designed to make police more accountable to the communities they serve. He did so without a mask on. And by the look of a video the White House sent out on Twitter shortly afterward, almost no one in attendance wore a mask either.

title: A Bee C: Scientists translate honeybee queen duets
description: Queens "quack" when ready to hatch - but if two are free at the same time, they fight to the death.

title: Atatiana Jefferson: 'Why I will no longer call the police'
description: When James Smith called police to check his neighbour was OK, she ended up dead. Never again, he says.

title: Your tributes to those who have died
description: A collection of your tributes to some of the thousands of people in the UK who have died with coronavirus.

title: These films explore black lives impacted by white authority
description: Following the wave of demonstrations sparked by the killing of George Floyd, many of us have been thinking about the history of race in America, and the ongoing narrative of police violence. We are all looking for resources to help better understand the moment.

title: Police officers across the US are quitting
description: Since George Floyd's death three weeks ago, the role of America's criminal justice system has been catapulted to the forefront of national conversation with thousands calling for sweeping changes within the country's policing system.

title: Airlines ban alcohol in response to Covid-19
description: Alcohol sales may have boomed during lockdown, but our return to air travel will be an altogether more sobering experience.

title: It's time to get back to non-Covid health care
description: Near the outset of the grueling war against Covid-19,  President Donald Trump directed my agency, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), to recommend the postponement of non-emergency elective surgeries and procedures. The looming threat of a shortage of personal protective equipment and other supplies for health care workers in the face of a surge in cases made this the right call under the circumstances.

title: Coronavirus: ‘I’ve applied for more than 100 jobs’
description: Kayleigh Rennix is among thousands of people looking for work during the coronavirus crisis.

title: India-China dispute: The border row explained in 400 words
description: Here's what you need to know about a border dispute that has turned deadly high in the Himalayas.

title: A black officer intervened when a white cop had a suspect in a chokehold. She was fired.
description: Officials in Buffalo, New York, want an investigation into the firing of a black police officer who intervened when a white colleague had a suspect in a chokehold.

title: George Floyd death: 'The same happened to my son'
description: An immigrant community divided by the anti-racist protests rocking the US.

title: Hank Williams Jr.'s daughter dies in crash
description: The daughter of country music star Hank Williams Jr. has died in a car crash. Katherine Williams-Dunning was 27.

title: Opinion: Reimagining policing will make us safer
description: The brutal death of George Floyd has rightly trained our eyes on systemic racism and bias in our criminal justice system and the long history of law enforcement's excessive use of force, which is most often aimed at black Americans. It is clear that nothing short of a complete transformation of policing is necessary to ensure safety for the people of our country.

title: Coronavirus: How dangerous is lifting lockdown?
description: Why is lifting restrictions being described as a "dangerous moment"?

title: CIA cyber weapons stolen in historic breach due to 'woefully lax security'
description: The largest theft of data in CIA history happened because a specialized unit within the agency was so focused on building cyber weapons that an employee took advantage of "woefully lax" security and gave secret hacking tools to WikiLeaks, according to an internal report released on Tuesday.

title: Coronavirus: Are protests legal amid lockdown?
description: Black Lives Matter protests continue in the UK - but are they illegal under restrictions on gatherings?

title: India-China clash: 20 Indian troops killed in Ladakh fighting
description: It is the first deadly skirmish in decades between the two regional powers at their disputed border.

title: PG&E pleads guilty to 85 counts in 2018 Camp Fire
description: California utility Pacific Gas and Electric Company pleaded guilty Tuesday to 84 counts of involuntary manslaughter and one count of unlawfully starting the Camp Fire.

title: New York City crime stats show spike in burglaries and murders so far this year
description: Murder, burglary and grand larceny auto crimes have spiked in New York City this past month compared to the same period last year, while rape, robbery and grand larceny crimes have declined, according to New York Police Department statistics.

title: Pentagon warns China is exploiting Covid-19 to wage 'economic warfare' on the US
description: Defense officials are increasingly concerned China is using the coronavirus crisis to gain stakes in strategically important businesses as the pandemic leaves struggling companies urgently in need of capital.

title: Coronavirus: What is a recession?
description: The world faces the worst recession for 80 years. But what does that mean?

title: Navajo Nation: The people battling America's worst coronavirus outbreak
description: The challenges of life in the Navajo Nation have made containing Covid-19 even more difficult.

title: 'I'm sorry for being racist when I was younger'
description: Two young people who were racist when they were younger explain why they have changed.

title: Google kicked ZeroHedge off its ad platform and warned the Federalist
description: Google has taken action against two news websites over what it says are offensive remarks in their comment sections, banning one site from making money off its advertising platforms and threatening to ban the other.

title: As protesters decry Brooks' death, a police union official says due process must be served
description: Newly released records show the officer who shot and killed Rayshard Brooks in Atlanta last week had several citizen complaints against him prior to the incident.

title: Twenty Indian soldiers dead after clash with China along disputed border
description: Three Indian soldiers were killed during a "violent face-off" with Chinese troops along the countries' de facto border in the Himalayas late Monday, the Indian army said in a statement.
